com.blogspot.debukkitsblog.net

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blogspot.debukkitsblog.net.Server

  • public abstract class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    A very simple-to-use Server class for Java network applications
    originally created on March 9, 2016 in Horstmar, Germany
    Version:
    2.3.2
    Author:
    Leonard Bienbeck

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(int port)
        Constructs a simple server listening on the given port. Every client that connects to this server is registered and can receive broadcast and direct messages, the connection will be kept alive using a ping and ssl will not be used.
        Parameters:
        port - The port to listen on

      • Server

        public Server(int port,
              boolean autoRegisterEveryClient,
              boolean keepConnectionAlive,
              boolean useSSL)
        Constructs a simple server with all possible configurations
        Parameters:
        port - The port to listen on
        autoRegisterEveryClient - Whether a client that connects should be registered to send it broadcast and direct messages later
        keepConnectionAlive - Whether the connection should be kept alive using a ping package. The transmission interval can be set using setPingInterval(int seconds).
        useSSL - Whether SSL should be used to establish a secure connection

    • Method Detail

      • setMuted

        public void setMuted(boolean muted)
        Mutes the console output of this instance, errors will still be printed
        Parameters:
        muted - true if there should be no console output, except error messages

      • setPingInterval

        public void setPingInterval(int seconds)
        Sets the interval in which ping packages should be sent to keep the connection alive. Default is 30 seconds.
        Parameters:
        seconds - The interval in which ping packages should be sent

      • sendReply

        public void sendReply(java.net.Socket toSocket,
                      java.lang.Object... datapackageContent)
        Sends a reply to client. This method should only be called from within the run-Method of an Executable implementation.
        Parameters:
        toSocket - The socket the message should be delivered to
        datapackageContent - The content of the message to be delivered. The ID of this Datapackage will be "REPLY".

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String remoteClientId,
                        java.lang.String datapackageId,
                        java.lang.Object... datapackageContent)
        Sends a message to a client with specified id
        Parameters:
        remoteClientId - The id of the client it registered on login
        datapackageId - The id of message
        datapackageContent - The content of the message

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String remoteClientId,
                        Datapackage message)
        Sends a message to a client with specified id
        Parameters:
        remoteClientId - The id of the client it registered on login
        message - The message

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(com.blogspot.debukkitsblog.net.Server.RemoteClient remoteClient,
                        java.lang.String datapackageId,
                        java.lang.Object... datapackageContent)
        Sends a message to a client
        Parameters:
        remoteClient - The target client
        datapackageId - The id of message
        datapackageContent - The content of the message

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(com.blogspot.debukkitsblog.net.Server.RemoteClient remoteClient,
                        Datapackage message)
        Sends a message to a client
        Parameters:
        remoteClient - The target client
        message - The message

      • sendMessage

        @Deprecated
public void sendMessage(Datapackage message,
                                     com.blogspot.debukkitsblog.net.Server.RemoteClient remoteClient)
        Deprecated. 
        Use sendMessage(RemoteClient remoteClient, Datapackage message) instead. Only the order of the parameters has changed.
        Parameters:
        message - The message
        remoteClient - The client

      • broadcastMessageToGroup

        public int broadcastMessageToGroup(java.lang.String group,
                                   Datapackage message)
        Broadcasts a message to a group of clients
        Parameters:
        group - The group name the clients registered on their login
        message - The message
        Returns:
        The number of clients reached

      • broadcastMessage

        public int broadcastMessage(Datapackage message)
        Broadcasts a message to a group of clients
        Parameters:
        message - The message
        Returns:
        The number of clients reached

      • registerMethod

        public void registerMethod(java.lang.String identifier,
                           Executable executable)
        Registers a method that will be executed if a message containing identifier is received
        Parameters:
        identifier - The ID of the message to proccess
        executable - The method to be called when a message with identifier is received

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the server

      • getClientCount

        public int getClientCount()
        Counts the number of clients registered
        Returns:
        The number of clients registered

      • preStart

        public abstract void preStart()
        Called just before the actual server starts. Register your handler methods in here using registerMethod(String identifier, Executable executable)!

      • onClientRegistered

        public void onClientRegistered()
        Called on the listener's main thread when a new client registers

      • onClientRegistered

        public void onClientRegistered(Datapackage msg,
                               java.net.Socket socket)
        Called on the listener's main thread when a new client registers
        Parameters:
        msg - The message the client registered with
        socket - The socket the client registered with. Be careful with this! You should not close this socket, because the server should have stored it normally to reach this client later.

      • onSocketRemoved

        @Deprecated
public void onSocketRemoved(java.net.Socket socket)
        Deprecated. 
        Use onClientRemoved(RemoteClient remoteClient) instead. Only the name of the method has changed.
        Parameters:
        socket - The socket of the client that was removed from the list of reachable clients

      • onClientRemoved

        public void onClientRemoved(com.blogspot.debukkitsblog.net.Server.RemoteClient remoteClient)
        Called on the listener's main thread when a client is removed from the list. This normally happens if there was a problem with its connection. You should wait for the client to connect again.
        Parameters:
        remoteClient - The client that was removed from the list of reachable clients
